and supply the answers which, as Commander of the 
Expedition, I am the best fitted person to give: 
1. What Instructions are referred to, by whom were 
they drawn up, to whom were they communicated, and 
where may a copy now be found? 
2. What specially provided opportunity for 'practising 
the working of the recording instruments beforehand' 
was neglected and by whom? 
3. What changes of Staff are referred to? How did 
these lead to the loss of instructions concerning, or 
opportunities for working the self recording instruments? 
I know of no special opportunities provided 
for practising the working of the self recording 
instruments though I gratefully acknowledge the courtesy 
of the Director and Officials of Kew to members of the 
Expedition who visited the Observatory for instruction. 
I know of no change in the Staff which can 
have effected the loss of instructions or opportunities 
for practising with meteorological instruments. 
I can therefore find no basis of fact for 
the suggestions made in this paragraph and as I shall 
proceed to show , the misfortunes alleged to have resulted 
from the failure of 'well intentioned efforts' are as unsubstantiated as the cause to which they are traced. <u>For<\u>
